messages.title: The choice you face
messages.content: This election, you have a choice about the kind of Britain you want to live in. Labour will: Deliver an additional 50,000 childcare places by using unspent bank levy funds; Double paternity pay; Cut tuition fees; and Raise minimum wage.

messages.title: A local candidate
messages.content: Julian Ware-Lane is a local candidate with a passion for both the town and its residents. Coming from a business background, Julian now teaches mathematics at a college in Cambridge. He has a history of community involvement and has demonstrated his commitment to the area by standing as a Labour candidate previously.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Deliver an additional 50,000 childcare places by using unspent bank levy funds.

issues.health: Saving our NHS by investing in staff; ending the privatisation; creating better opportunities for the next generation.

housing.content: Labour will deliver the sustainable growth and rising living standards that our country needs and ensure our economy works for working people in Southend West.

He has a history of community involvement and has demonstrated his commitment to the area by standing as a Labour candidate previously.
